conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow through baffles to determine which container each stream flows into.
There are four liquid entry points at the top: A, B, C, and D.
There are six colored baffle obstacles scattered across the board: red, green, white, gray, pink, and black.
At the bottom, there are two collection containers: E (left) and F (right).
The containers at the bottom have a house-like shape with turquoise (E) and white (F) outlines.
Liquid from point A would flow downward.
Liquid from point A would encounter the red diagonal baffle.
The red baffle is angled downward from left to right.
The red baffle would deflect the liquid from A toward the right side.
Liquid from A would continue downward and rightward, likely missing other baffles.
Liquid from A would flow into container F.
Liquid from point B would flow downward.
Liquid from point B would encounter the green diagonal baffle.
The green baffle is angled downward from right to left.
The green baffle would deflect the liquid from B toward the left side.
Liquid from B would continue downward and leftward, avoiding other baffles.
Liquid from B would flow into container E.
Liquid from point C would flow downward.
Liquid from point C would likely encounter the gray diagonal baffle.
The gray baffle is angled downward from left to right.
The gray baffle would deflect the liquid from C toward the right side.
Liquid from C would continue downward and rightward.
Liquid from C would flow into container F.
Liquid from point D would flow downward.
Liquid from point D would encounter the pink diagonal baffle.
